page.title: 05FARMING..CROPS/MARKETS
page.content:
The main crops grown at Pitbladdo are:
Malt barley - 400 acres Wheat - 110 acres Oilseed rape - 90 acres Ware potatoes - 65 acres Barley - 65 acres Oats - 50 acres
Some peas are also grown which are dried and used for cattle feed. The malt barley is sold to beer and whisky industries, but as this market is declining the farm is intending to cut down production of this crop and increase production of wheat and oilseed rape. Oilseed rape is at present the most profitable crop, bringing in Â£400 per acre.
